title: Which one is grammatically correct, “I have been waiting for a long time” or “I have been waiting for so long”? - Quora

response.answer_text: I disagree with the previous answer. Both are correct. Both give the impression of the same thing, you are tired of waiting. But the second sentence leads the reader to feel sorry for you. You want to add more details in your next sentence. Example: I’ve been waiting for so long! My feet are aching from standing in line! (It is NOT a fragment. It just needs more explanation after.)

The first (“I have been waiting for a long time”) is grammatically correct. The second (“I have been waiting for so long”), though it reflects popular colloquial usage, is strictly speaking a sentence fragment. “So” is, in this sentence construction, a comparative adverb that calls for a new dependent clause introduced by “that.” Without that clause completing the thought, the sentence is elliptical—i.e., technically a sentence fragment.
